intro: Huberia weberbaueriana, commonly known as the Weberbauer's huberia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
